EY √® una delle societ√† Big 4 della consulenza. Quello che ci caratterizza rispetto alle altre aziende √® la possibilit√† di trasformare il business e il modo di lavorare dei nostri clienti, che siano grandi multinazionali, piccole imprese o pubbliche amministrazioni. Learning and Development: oltre 50 ore all‚Äôanno di formazione per ciascuna persona

La divisione AI&Data si distingue per la sua forte connessione con altre aree di competenza e per il supporto ai clienti in programmi di trasformazione dei processi, attraverso soluzioni innovative e integrate. Laureati o laureandi‚ÄØin‚ÄØmaterie ingegneristiche o scientifiche

Conoscenza approfondita di Python e delle librerie per la manipolazione dei dati e sviluppo di modelli (pandas,‚ÄØtensorflow,‚ÄØscikit-learn,‚ÄØpytorch,‚ÄØllamaIndex, langChaing, ecc‚Ä¶)

At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career
column2: learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

column1: Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.
You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

Step into the spotlight at Prima in the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.
ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.
üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities
We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column2: so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

column1: üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.
If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

Step into the spotlight at Prima as a Data Scientist of the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.

As a Data Scientist at Prima, your role is crucial in leveraging the power of artificial intelligence and advanced data analytics to decode the risks and opportunities presented by each new client. Your work directly influences our company's growth and long-term success, contributing to the achievement of our strategic goals.
Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for:
Academic Excellence : Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering Mathematics, Engineering Physics, or Statistics are a plus.
Experience Not Required : No prior work experience? No problem! We're eager to invest in your talent and education.
Analytical Prowess : Strong quantitative, logical, and analytical skills are essential. At Prima, you'll tackle diverse and stimulating challenges that will put your skills to the test.
Curiosity and Innovation : We value curiosity, proactivity, and pragmatism. You'll be encouraged to pursue common goals in original and innovative ways, shaping the future with your ideas.
We're Also Interested In Candidates Who
Have international experience and are fluent in English and Italian.
Possess a solid foundation in programming and machine learning.
Know how to create and manipulate datasets using data mining languages like MySQL or Redshift.

Research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!
If you're curious about experiencing a day in the life of a Data Scientist, take a look at this video from our Head of Pricing & Underwriting Italy.

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

Data scientist
La risorsa si occuper√† di analisi, mantenimento e sviluppo evolutivo su applicativi che forniscono supporto operativo. In particolare, le soluzioni prevedono:
Natural Language Processing: estrazione entit√† da stringhe (NER) e classificazione di testi/email con reti neurali (transformers)

Completano il profilo: flessibilit√†, capacit√† di analisi e di problem solving, autonomia, orientamento al raggiungimento degli obiettivi, attitudine al team work e ottime doti relazionali.

¬∑ Statistical data processing (data mining)

- Solid academic record.

What we offer

courses and language courses.
- Last year our staff as a whole received over 375,000 hours of training
spanning more than 150 courses.

- Internal promotion based solely on merit.

Il tuo ruolo

‚Ä¢ Costruzione di modelli predittivi utilizzando tecniche di machine learning e data science.

4214615618,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-analyst-at-generali-4214615618?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=OxfeR89%2FFpARESB4f8VdQw%3D%3D,Data Science Analyst,Generali,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","For the Central Team of Generali Global Corporate & Commercial (GC&C), we are looking for a Data Science Analyst to join our Insurance Department. Reporting to the Head of Technical Excellence, this position is key to leveraging data insights for comprehensive technical analysis, pricing strategies, and effective portfolio management. With a dynamic, cross-functional approach, the role includes demanding data integration across key domains such as Underwriting, Risk Engineering, and Claims, thereby contributing significantly to the company's strategic objectives. In addition, you will contribute to the development of the sustainability agenda of GC&C, working on carbon emission, green energy, and climate change initiatives.
Main responsibilities:
Portfolio Management
Supporting the analysis of the overall GC&C portfolio results, trends and patterns
Designing and deploying the portfolio management discipline
Implementing the portfolio monitoring tools
Assisting BU in the target setting and supporting BU in achieving targets
Performing data quality checks at all stages of portfolio management
Preparation and steering of Portfolio review meetings
Assisting UW functions in steering the business accordingly.
Innovation
Working collaboratively on pioneering new actuarial tools, integrating Machine Learning algorithms to enhance predictive capabilities
Actively participate in defining business requirements to evolve the TechEx technology stack, in partnership with Operations
Facilitate training sessions for the GC&C underwriting community on the TechEx tool suite, promoting skill enhancement and tool.
Sustainability and Net Zero Transition
Driving forward GC&C sustainability initiatives also in collaboration with Group Head Office
Contributing to the development of a technical framework to embed Net Zero targets into GC&C underwriting strategy.
Requirements
The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:
Studied Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Statistics or other quantitative disciplines, e.g. Engineering, Physics etc.
Quantitative, analytical mindset, problem solving skills
Insurance business processes knowledge experience is welcome
Ability to build lasting relationships
Strong communication and presentation skills
Familiarity with Python and R is valued
Must be fluent in Italian, English, additional languages are an advantage
Company Profile
Generali is a major player in the global insurance industry ‚Äì a strategic and highly important sector for the growth, development and welfare of modern societies.

Over almost 200 years, we have built a multinational group that is present in more than 50 countries, with 470 companies and nearly 82,000 employees. Our group aims to become the standard bearer and industry leader in the European retail insurance market, building on our existing base of 50 million retail clients, out of an overall total of 72 million.

Global Corporate & Commercial is the Generali Group unit developing P&C business and insurance services for medium and large companies. The unit acts on a global scale and deploys an integrated approach at Group level with a central management team and specialized teams active in individual countries. Through GC&C, Generali aims to become a key world player in the corporate-commercial segment.

Generali is proud to be an inclusive employer that considers applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, religion, political views, marital status or philosophy of life.
If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation or assistance, we will support you during the selection process.

The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:


  • Studied Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Statistics or other quantitative disciplines, e.g. Engineering, Physics etc.
  • Quantitative, analytical mindset, problem solving skills
  • Insurance business processes knowledge experience is welcome
  • Ability to build lasting relationships
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Familiarity with Python and R is valued
  • Must be fluent in Italian, English, additional languages are an advantage


Company Profile

Generali is a major player in the global insurance industry ‚Äì a strategic and highly important sector for the growth, development and welfare of modern societies.

Over almost 200 years, we have built a multinational group that is present in more than 50 countries, with 470 companies and nearly 82,000 employees. Our group aims to become the standard bearer and industry leader in the European retail insurance market, building on our existing base of 50 million retail clients, out of an overall total of 72 million.

Global Corporate &
column18: Commercial is the Generali Group unit developing P&
column19: C business and insurance services for medium and large companies. The unit acts on a global scale and deploys an integrated approach at Group level with a central management team and specialized teams active in individual countries. Through GC&amp
column20:
C, Generali aims to become a key world player in the corporate-commercial segment.


Generali is proud to be an inclusive employer that considers applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, religion, political views, marital status or philosophy of life.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation or assistance, we will support you during the selection process.

4199198185,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-gruppo-excellence-4199198185?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=sl5YYyPcHkQRpe5%2FR%2BSB9A%3D%3D,DATA SCIENTIST,Gruppo Excellence,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Excellence √® un gruppo multi-boutique formato da pi√π societ√† con diversa specializzazione: dalla Consulenza Strategica, al ridisegno dei modelli operativi, e al Change Management, fino a coprire temi pi√π innovativi come la Digital Disruption oppure la transizione dei modelli di business in chiave ESG.

Il Gruppo √® stato fondato nel 2007 e rappresenta uno dei pi√π significativi casi di successo di start-up che in breve tempo √® riuscita a crescere ed affermarsi nel settore dei professional services.

Dataskills opera a 360¬∞ nel settore della Data Science, aiutando ad estrarre valore dal patrimonio di dati aziendale. Leader italiano in questo campo, ricerca e sviluppa negli ambiti di Business Intelligence, Big Data Analytics, Analisi Predittiva, Artificial Intelligence, e IOT e collabora con le principali aziende dell‚Äôindustria 4.0.
Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa brillante da inserire nel ruolo di: DATA SCIENTIST
Cosa farai?
Svilupperai soluzioni avanzate di Predictive Analytics ed AI Generativa progettando modelli di Machine Learning e architetture AI per supportare le decisioni strategiche aziendali
Riceverai supporto e formazione da esperti del settore per affinare costantemente le tue competenze
Lavorerai su progetti sfidanti che richiederanno l'applicazione di tecniche di data science all'avanguardia

Prenderai parte allo sviluppo delle competenze interne all‚Äôarea DataSkills e contribuirai alla crescita dell‚Äôazienda portando idee, spunti individuali e proposte di nuovi progetti e prodotti, seguendone lo sviluppo verso i clienti.
Chi ricerchiamo?
Esperienza di almeno 1 anno in ruoli relativi a Data Analytics, Machine Learning o GenAI
Passione per i dati e abilit√† nell‚Äôanalisi di informazioni complesse
Capacit√† di presentazione, comunicazione e sintesi di informazioni tecniche
Padronanza consolidata di Python, utilizzato come principale strumento di analisi e sviluppo di modelli predittivi
Solida competenza in SQL, con abilit√† nel progettare query.
Conoscenza di algoritmi, modelli e principali tecniche di Machine Learning
Ottime doti relazionali, capacit√† organizzative, proattivit√† ed entusiasmo
Capacit√† di leadership, capacit√† relazionale e predisposizione al lavoro di gruppo
Conoscenza della lingua inglese al livello B2 o superiore (Riferimento: Common European Framework of Reference for Languages)
Conoscenza della lingua italiana al livello C1 o superiore (Riferimento: CEFR Common European Framework of Reference for Languages).
Gradita, ma non essenziale:
Esperienza nella costruzione di Data Warehouse/Data Lake
Esperienza con Apache Spark ed Azure Databricks
Perch√© Gruppo Excellence?
Farai parte della nostra crescita

Sarai coinvolto/a in progetti strategici e innovativi per lo sviluppo del business aziendale e potrai lavorare direttamente con il Top Management delle aziende cliente. Chi entrer√† a fare parte della nostra squadra trover√† un ambiente di lavoro giovane, smart, proattivo e stimolante e avr√† la possibilit√† di lavorare nell‚Äôambito di progetti dinamici per aziende leader nei mercati di riferimento.
Svilupperai il tuo potenziale

Avrai accesso alla nostra piattaforma di formazione Excellence Academy, con un catalogo sempre aggiornato di corsi su hard e soft skills che accresceranno le tue competenze su numerose tematiche. Premiamo il merito e il talento, anche attraverso un percorso di carriera personalizzato: ti daremo la possibilit√† di realizzare aspirazioni personali in linea con gli obiettivi aziendali.
Siamo un‚Äôorganizzazione orizzontale in cui la voce di ciascuno viene accolta e valorizzata!
Ci impegniamo a promuovere e a tutelare il valore delle nostre persone, necessarie e fondamentali per lo sviluppo del knowledge aziendale.
Avrai un ottimo work-life balance

Troverai una policy che supporta il lavoro flessibile e la possibilit√† di lavorare da casa quando necessario. Ti riserviamo un piano welfare per acquisto abbonamenti mezzi pubblici, buoni spesa, corsi, ingressi cinema, abbonamenti palestre, viaggi e molto altro.
Lavorerai in un ambiente inclusivo ed equo

Valorizziamo la diversit√†, l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunit√† lavorative. Il nostro processo di selezione √® meritocratico e lontano da qualsivoglia forma di discriminazione diretta o indiretta, nel rispetto dei migliori standard internazionali e delle leggi applicabili (inclusi ma non limitati alla L. 903/77).

4206856216,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-italy-bcg-x-at-bcg-x-4206856216?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=hWyU1WCTUSTKfsd3IFSkjg%3D%3D,"Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X",BCG X,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.
What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Fluency in both Italian and English
#BCGXjob
What You'll Bring
Requirements
Master‚Äôs or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field
Technologies
Programming: Python
#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Data Scientist all‚Äôinterno della struttura Data Science Office. La struttura ha tra le principali responsabilit√† quella di supportare a livello di Gruppo l‚Äôindividuazione di utilizzi dei dati per estrarne il maggior valore possibile e supportare le unit√† locali nel Business nello sviluppo di use cases, nella realizzazione e nel miglioramento delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, anche promuovendo la diffusione di best-practice, standard e know-how.
Per quale societ√†

Ti occuperai di
Esplorazione e analisi di elevate moli di dati al fine di supportare l‚Äôelaborazione delle soluzioni di Advanced Analytics

Applicazione di tecniche statistiche avanzate, machine learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining (analisi time series, alberi decisionali, algoritmi di clusterizzazione come K-mean, random forest, reti neurali‚Ä¶) e tecniche di Intelligenza Artificiale Generativa
Collaborazione attiva con il team per supportare e implementare la messa in produzione dei progetti
Partecipazione proattiva all‚Äôinnovazione e all‚Äôottimizzazione dei processi aziendali
Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
Laurea Magistrale in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria, Informatica
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in ambito di tecniche di Advanced Analytics, modellazione e analisi statistica di elevate moli di dati
Consolidata esperienza nella gestione di database e data warehouse su larga scala (SQL/NoSQL), e l‚Äôutilizzo di tecnologie Big Data (Spark, ...)
Conoscenza avanzata di Python e delle librerie di Machine Learning
Conoscenza dei Cloud Provider Google (GCP), Amazon (AWS) e Microsoft (Azure)

Rappresenta un requisito fondamentale esperienza o conoscenza di tecniche avanzate di Machine Learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining e Generative AI
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese

Completano il profilo: forte orientamento al team working e capacit√† di interfacciarsi con interlocutori a diversi livelli, pensiero critico e capacit√† di problem solving, attitudine a lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, collaborativo con organizzazione agile (startuplike)

4197426120,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-banca-aidexa-4197426120?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=GH4bonCxfw7vL58aF4%2F0jw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Banca AideXa,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Il nostro scopo?
Essere la fintech bank di riferimento per le micro e piccole imprese italiane, offrendo esperienze finanziarie digitali e innovative
Cosa abbiamo fatto fino ad ora?

Siamo una fintech bank che cresce velocissima! In soli quattro anni abbiamo ottenuto la licenza bancaria, raggiunto il breakeven, siamo stati tre volte tra LinkedIn Top Startups (al 1¬∞, 2¬∞ e 3¬∞ posto), abbiamo lanciato 6 prodotti completamente digitali, superato i 20.000 clienti e un miliardo ‚Ç¨ di finanziamenti erogati. In poco tempo abbiamo costruito un brand giovane e solido.
Siamo 110+ AideXer: motivati, sperimentatori e pronti ad innovare il modo di fare banca!
Come Data Scientist sarai inserit* all‚Äôinterno dell'area Data Science, a diretto riporto del Lead Data Scientist.
üöÄLe tue attivit√†
Contribuire all‚ÄôR&D in Data Science applicata al lendingTech
Collaborare con i business stakeholder di dominio individuando nuove aree di miglioramento e impiego fruttuoso di modelli di AI o soluzioni algoritmiche data-driven
Progettare, testare e rilasciare modelli predittivi utilizzati real-time per le decisioni automatiche della Banca
Contribuire allo sviluppo della Credit Decision Platform, la piattaforma che orchestra l‚Äôesecuzione real-time dei modelli durante l‚Äôonboarding di clienti prospettici
Implementare ‚Äì tramite best-practices di MLOps ‚Äì il monitoraggio e/o la ricalibrazione dei modelli in produzione
Preparare e mantenere un'adeguata documentazione sui modelli.
üß¨Le tue caratteristiche
L‚ÄôAideXer che fa per noi ha:
Una laurea magistrale in discipline STEM (Matematica, Fisica, Data Science, Computer Science)
Almeno un anno di esperienza lavorativa in Data Science (o un PhD)
Esperienza con tecniche di Machine Learning / AI
Dimestichezza con Python e principali librerie di ML
Curiosit√† intellettuale, proattivit√†, spirito imprenditoriale e gioco di squadra.
üèÜCosa ti offriamo
Buoni pasto
Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa per te e per la tua famiglia

Approccio ibrido: Ci piace trascorrere dei momenti insieme in Casa X, il nostro ufficio nel üíö di Milano, che sono l'occasione per fare finalmente una pausa caff√®, partecipare a workshop e parlarsi senza essere in mute! Ci piace anche prenderci dei momenti in solitaria da remoto per quella presentazione piena di numeri che richiede un alto grado di concentrazione
L‚Äôopportunit√† unica di partecipare attivamente al nostro sviluppo e alla nostra crescita partendo dalle fondamenta
La possibilit√† di costruire la tua professionalit√† interfacciandoti con colleghi di grande esperienza nel panorama bancario e digitale italiano
Un ambiente di lavoro altamente sfidante e davvero formativo, in cui il tuo contributo sar√† fondamentale.

Valutiamo con molta attenzione tutte le candidature ricevute e apprezziamo moltissimo l‚Äôinteresse per il nostro progetto. Se questa opportunit√† sar√† allineata al tuo profilo sarai presto ricontattat*. Altrimenti terremo presente il tuo profilo anche per future ricerche.
Luogo di lavoro Milano

column1: Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.
You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on well-being, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.
ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.
üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities
We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column2: so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

column1: üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.
If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

At Prima, Data Scientists are part of the Pricing & Underwriting department , working within global teams that drive our international strategy. By applying for this role, you'll be considered for one of two global teams, and during the hiring process, we'll determine the best fit for your skills and expertise.

Our Global Pricing & Underwriting Teams are at the forefront of shaping our international strategy through data, analytics, and innovation. They transform complexity into structured, proactive solutions, enabling each market to identify opportunities for improvement and drive continuous growth.

By combining strategic vision with cutting-edge analytics, the team ensures a seamless approach to pricing and underwriting. Their work spans from defining and executing global strategies to developing advanced machine learning models and optimizing data pipelines. Through collaboration across multiple markets, they extract insights, identify scalable best practices, and enhance technical capabilities, making data-driven decision-making a core strength of Prima.
This unified approach empowers us to stay ahead in a dynamic industry, leveraging data and expertise to drive innovation, efficiency, and sustainable success. üöÄ
Join us and be part of a global team pushing the boundaries of Pricing & Underwriting through data.
As a Data Scientist in these teams, some of your activities could be

Design, build and evolve Prima‚Äôs proprietary predictive technology, in topics such as the prediction of future claims, tactical pricing, renewal probability, fraud detection and customer lifetime value, etc

Define and support the implementation in each country of the key tools to understand how the business is growing, for example, conversion, retention, emerging profitability. The monitoring tools need to be consistent at a global level and at the same time able to adapt to the different stages of evolution of each country
Support the countries in planning the pricing and UW strategy and consequent follow up
Develop a strong critical spirit and creativity that can act as an engine for Prima's growth.
Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for
Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Computer science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematical Engineering or Physical Engineering
From graduates to people with 2+ years of working/research experience: we‚Äôre open to evaluate the seniority during the recruitment process
Strong Python programming skills - especially in the data domain - and fluent use of GIT
Excellent English level, oral & written
You have a genuine, collaborative mindset that inspires and guides others.
In addition to the basic requirements, we will carefully evaluate these characteristics as a plus
You have previous work experience in similar roles
Knowledge of Spark, SQL or any other data-oriented programming language and proficiency with standard data wrangling and modeling libraries (Pandas, Sklearn. Keras, XGBboost, LightGBM, etc.)
Knowledge of BI tools (Tableau or similar)

Strong background in mathematical optimization, linear and nonlinear programming, convex optimization, combinatorial optimization techniques, metaheuristics (such as genetic algorithms, simulated annealing, and particle swarm optimization), and stochastic optimization methods.

Remember, research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

4200143172,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-at-prometeia-4200143172?position=22&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=HHrnrgl6%2FyZiscemkeAH2A%3D%3D,Junior Data Scientist,Prometeia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Junior Data Scientist
Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?
Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.
We are looking for candidates interested in enriching our Data Science team, and the development of new technologies/tools related to it.
PROFILE:

The ideal candidate is a student / new graduate in machine learning / big data engineering subjects. He/she is interested in using large amounts of data to develop models and applications in the financial / insurance domain. He/she is also interested in software engineering and is willing to gain experience in the scientific computing domain.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Critical analysis of large volumes of banking/insurance data.
Participation in the development of behavioral models using Artificial Intelligence in the areas of Risk, Wealth & Asset Management.
Participation in analysis sharing, problem solving, implementation, testing and documentation activities as part of projects assigned to the team.
Development and review of simple prototypes/analytic components within more complex pipelines.
REQUIREMENTS:
Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms.
Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration, and feature extraction.
Familiarity with Python libraries and tools for Machine Learning (numpy/pandas) and scientific computing.
Attention to detail, excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Critical/experimental approach to data analysis.
NICE TOHAVE:
Ability to rapidly define ideas and solutions, develop critical analyses, and use creative approaches to solve complex problems.
Experience with code versioning systems (git).
Experience in Pyspark development.
Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's/Master's degree with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields (PhD in the same fields is nice to have)
Experience in a corporate environment (including internships), preferably in finance or insurance.
LOCATION:
Milan/Bologna

4208214211,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-junior-pricing-at-allianz-direct-4208214211?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=OFcEGMVrlqr7qmLMQLCWqw%3D%3D,DATA SCIENTIST JUNIOR -PRICING,Allianz Direct,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Job Purpose/Role
The candidate would be required to provide support to Actuarial Modelling unit carrying out the following activities:
Data collection and preparation for further analysis and modelling
Develop and update statistical models for Motor products using advanced statistical techniques like GLM and Machine learning approach
Analysis of classification based on technical features
Demand models with application of different algorithms
Tariff definition/revision based on evidence from statistical models
Assessment on a regular basis of the quality and correctness of the models
Data exploration to improve model predictiveness
Update of the portfolio analysis with the main Kpis to monitor the acquired portfolio
Data processing to support standard portfolio or ad hoc simulation and monitoring analysis.
Key Requirements/Skills/Experience
Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial, Physics or Computer Science
Sas\Sql, Python
Office
Strong analysis, problem-solving, and communication skills
Curious about new approaches and committed to continually increase technical knowledge
Team spirit, self-motivation, and a proactive result-driven working style as well as ability to interact in a global work environment with people from different countries and cultures.
Fluent in Italian and English

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5

Job Purpose/Role

The candidate would be required to provide support to Actuarial Modelling unit carrying out the following activities:

  • Data collection and preparation for further analysis and modelling
  • Develop and update statistical models for Motor products using advanced statistical techniques like GLM and Machine learning approach
  • Analysis of classification based on technical features
  • Demand models with application of different algorithms
  • Tariff definition/revision based on evidence from statistical models
  • Assessment on a regular basis of the quality and correctness of the models
  • Data exploration to improve model predictiveness
  • Update of the portfolio analysis with the main Kpis to monitor the acquired portfolio
  • Data processing to support standard portfolio or ad hoc simulation and monitoring analysis.

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

  • Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial, Physics or Computer Science
  • Sas\Sql, Python
  • Office
  • Strong analysis, problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Curious about new approaches and committed to continually increase technical knowledge
  • Team spirit, self-motivation, and a proactive result-driven working style as well as ability to interact in a global work environment with people from different countries and cultures.
  • Fluent in Italian and English

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

Digital360 S.p.A., nata nel 2012, da giugno 2021 √® Societ√† Benefit.

Digital Attitude, parte del Gruppo Digital360, si dedica a creare un equilibrio tra persone e tecnologia. Con un'esperienza consolidata nel change & tech adoption, combina competenze tecnologiche e approcci data-driven con un profondo know-how in psicologia, neuropsicologia e scienze sociali.

L'integrazione di intelligenza artificiale e agenti virtuali nelle applicazioni aziendali sta diventando una realt√† sempre pi√π diffusa. Questo rappresenta un momento cruciale in cui l‚Äôapproccio innovativo diventa indispensabile per creare un impatto positivo e duraturo sui clienti.

Digital Attitude √® alla ricerca di un candidato/a per la posizione di Junior AI Engineer. La figura contribuir√† alla creazione e dell‚Äôaddestramento degli agenti AI per progetti su clienti. Collaborer√† a stretto contatto con i referenti business per comprendere i requisiti funzionali, e con le figure tecniche per integrare il modello nel contesto architetturale e applicativo del cliente.
Principali Responsabilit√†
Progettare, sviluppare e testare agenti AI in grado di comprendere e rispondere a specifici casi d‚Äôuso aziendali.
Progettare e implementare pipeline di addestramento, fine-tuning e deployment di LLM su contesti specifici.
Sperimentare e ottimizzare tecniche di prompt engineering, validandone l‚Äôefficacia su use case reali.
Sviluppare sistemi RAG combinando modelli generativi con sorgenti informative esterne.
Validare il comportamento dell‚Äôagente in scenari reali.
Collaborare in un team multidisciplinare (Designer, Business Analyst, Cloud Engineer, DevOps e Fullstack Engineer, QA) per la delivery di soluzioni AI verso clienti.
Capacit√† e competenze richieste
Familiarit√† con almeno uno dei principali modelli generativi (GPT, Gemini, LLaMA o equivalenti open-source).
Comprensione generale dei concetti di pipeline ML/AI e delle principali fasi di sviluppo (addestramento, validazione, deployment).
Interesse per la sperimentazione su tecniche di retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) e database vettoriali.
Precisione e cura dei dettagli.
Indipendenza professionale.
Attitudine al lavoro di squadra e desiderio di imparare da figure pi√π esperte.
Buon livello di conoscenza della lingua inglese, scritta e parlata.
Requisiti
Laurea triennale o magistrale (anche in corso) in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science, Linguistica Computazionale o discipline affini.
Esperienza, anche tramite progetti universitari, tesi o stage, nell‚Äôambito AI/ML, in particolare su NLP o Generative AI.
Progetti lavorativi o personali nel campo dell‚ÄôAI per automazione.
Sar√† considerato un plus:
Conoscenze di base in Python e prompt engineering.

Conoscenza dei principi Agile o partecipazione a team di sviluppo in contesti collaborativi.
Reports To: Senior AI Engineer
Location: Milano
Perch√® lavorare con noi:
Per entrare a far parte di una realt√† multidisciplinare dove il valore √® generato da sperimentazione e continuo scambio di competenze
Le nostre sedi offrono spazi di lavoro moderni e funzionali nei quali organizziamo frequentemente eventi, workshop e momenti formativi
Integriamo l‚ÄôAI nei nostri processi a supporto delle attivit√† che svolgiamo quotidianamente
Offriamo modalit√† di lavoro agili e flessibili, con possibilit√† di smart working

Di seguito un riepilogo del processo di selezione:
Valutazione della candidatura
Se la valutazione su carta √® positiva, viene organizzato un primo colloquio conoscitivo con il team People&Transformation di Gruppo.
Se l‚Äôesito del primo colloquio √® positivo, viene richiesto al candidato di svolgere un task legato al ruolo.

Viene fissato un secondo colloquio di un‚Äôora (videochiamata) con alcune figure chiave dell‚Äôazienda con cui il candidato/a collaborer√† principalmente.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed √® aperta a persone con disabilit√†, di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

4207886587,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-at-akamas-4207886587?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZNO8TWZw%2FKiPK8ZC7G8vSQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Scientist,Akamas,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Company Description

As the world is moving towards hybrid clouds and cloud native architectures, optimizing IT stacks to maximize cost efficiency, performance, and sustainability has become an increasingly complex task, involving hundreds of parameters and billions of combinations.

Akamas is a software platform that redefines IT performance optimization thanks to AI, automation, and domain expertise developed by working with some of the most demanding enterprise customers across the world, achieving unprecedented levels of performance, efficiency, and cost savings.
Job Description

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to contribute to the development of our core machine learning algorithms that drive automated optimization of our customer applications. You will contribute to improving our algorithms and develop new machine-learning methods for the automatic performance testing and tuning of modern software stacks.
The ideal candidate should have a strong interest in machine learning and statistical methods.
As a Junior Data Scientist, you will contribute to developing new technologies for automatic performance tuning using a variety of machine learning methods
column2: interacting with peer data scientists, software engineers, designers, product managers, and customers.

column1: Strong knowledge of machine learning fundamentals, eagerness to learn about Bayesian optimization and Gaussian processes, and an understanding of statistical methods is expected.
Job Responsibilities
As a Junior Data Scientist, you are expected to have an impact on our product evolution through individual contributions by:
Collaborating in research and development of innovative configuration autotuning algorithms for effective performance optimization of modern IT stacks
Developing statistical models on performance data, including time-series data
Performing exploratory data analysis
Visualizing data, reporting results and deriving useful knowledge using a data-driven approach.
Job Requirements
The candidate must have:
Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Support Vector Machines, RandomForests, etc.
Basic experience in applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good scripting and programming skills
Basic proficiency in the Python programming language
Basic experience in data science frameworks (such as scikit-learn, scipy, numpy, and pandas) and visualization frameworks (such as matplotlib, seaborn and plotly)
Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
The candidate should preferably have a basic experience with the following topics:
Performance engineering
MLOps practices
Kubernetes and containerizd applications
Java
Compensation & Benefits
Join Our Team and Make a Real Impact: in Akamas we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who want to be a driving force in their field, making a significant difference from day one

Flexibility and Trust: from the moment you step in, you're not just an employee, but you're part of a team of talented colleagues. Akamas value freedom and responsibility, giving you the autonomy to excel and contribute your best in Hybrid mode

Competitive Salary and Company Welfare: Your hard work deserves recognition! Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and dedication. As a part of our team, you'll also receive a company welfare package of ‚Ç¨600, useful for fuel, bills, wellness and well-being!

Sustainability: in our office, you will always have access to fresh fruit thanks to Cortilia. In Akamas, we are committed to connecting conscious customers with local products and producers, all while prioritizing environmental and social responsibility

Tech Your Way: choose your weapon in the tech battle! Whether you're team Mac or team Windows, we believe in equipping you with the tools that spark joy. After all, the only thing better than coding your next big idea is doing it on a laptop that suits your style!

Company Description



As the world is moving towards hybrid clouds and cloud native architectures, optimizing IT stacks to maximize cost efficiency, performance, and sustainability has become an increasingly complex task, involving hundreds of parameters and billions of combinations.


Akamas is a software platform that redefines IT performance optimization thanks to AI, automation, and domain expertise developed by working with some of the most demanding enterprise customers across the world, achieving unprecedented levels of performance, efficiency, and cost savings.


Job Description


We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to contribute to the development of our core machine learning algorithms that drive automated optimization of our customer applications. You will contribute to improving our algorithms and develop new machine-learning methods for the automatic performance testing and tuning of modern software stacks.

The ideal candidate should have a strong interest in machine learning and statistical methods.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will contribute to developing new technologies for automatic performance tuning using a variety of machine learning methods
column2:
interacting with peer data scientists, software engineers, designers, product managers, and customers.

Strong knowledge of machine learning fundamentals, eagerness to learn about Bayesian optimization and Gaussian processes, and an understanding of statistical methods is expected.


Job Responsibilities

As a Junior Data Scientist, you are expected to have an impact on our product evolution through individual contributions by:


  • Collaborating in research and development of innovative configuration autotuning algorithms for effective performance optimization of modern IT stacks
  • Developing statistical models on performance data, including time-series data
  • Performing exploratory data analysis
  • Visualizing data, reporting results and deriving useful knowledge using a data-driven approach.


Job Requirements

The candidate must have:

  • Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience
  • Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Support Vector Machines, RandomForests, etc.
  • Basic experience in applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
  • Good scripting and programming skills
  • Basic proficiency in the Python programming language
  • Basic experience in data science frameworks (such as scikit-learn, scipy, numpy, and pandas) and visualization frameworks (such as matplotlib, seaborn and plotly)
  • Good communication skills and ability to work in a team environment


The candidate should preferably have a basic experience with the following topics:

  • Performance engineering
  • MLOps practices
  • Kubernetes and containerizd applications
  • Java


Compensation &
column3:
Benefits

  • Join Our Team and Make a Real Impact: in Akamas we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who want to be a driving force in their field, making a significant difference from day one
  • Flexibility and Trust: from the moment you step in, you're not just an employee, but you're part of a team of talented colleagues. Akamas value freedom and responsibility, giving you the autonomy to excel and contribute your best in Hybrid mode
  • Competitive Salary and Company Welfare: Your hard work deserves recognition! Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and dedication. As a part of our team, you'll also receive a company welfare package of ‚Ç¨600, useful for fuel, bills, wellness and well-being!
  • Sustainability: in our office, you will always have access to fresh fruit thanks to Cortilia. In Akamas, we are committed to connecting conscious customers with local products and producers, all while prioritizing environmental and social responsibility
  • Tech Your Way: choose your weapon in the tech battle! Whether you're team Mac or team Windows, we believe in equipping you with the tools that spark joy. After all, the only thing better than coding your next big idea is doing it on a laptop that suits your style!

4149023507,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-scientist-intern-at-integral-ad-science-4149023507?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Y33VH0cILn14djWwzqrJ0g%3D%3D,Machine Learning Scientist Intern,Integral Ad Science,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3: and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

column1: As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.
What you‚Äôll get to do:

Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).

Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.
You should apply if you have most of this experience:
Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.
About Integral Ad Science

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.
Equal Opportunity Employer:

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.
California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.
To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3:
and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.

What you‚Äôll get to do:

  • Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).
  • Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
  • Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
  • Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.


You should apply if you have most of this experience:

  • Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
  • Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
  • Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
  • Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.


About Integral Ad Science

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.

To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

4210835778,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-at-unicredit-4210835778?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=GkHhRgA4HdtgGiW%2Fc2UkZA%3D%3D,AI Engineer,UniCredit,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We are looking for an AI engineer to join our AI factory team. You will be responsible for E2E applications development leveraging AI and generative AI capabilities. Your goal will be to design and implement scalable AI systems built around deep learning and machine learning models as well as large language models.
You will collaborate in a dynamic and innovative context in close collaboration with Architects, Data Scientists and Business Translators.What you can expect from us
Design and development of innovative and cutting-edge AI solutions
Contribute to the scale-up of AI adoption through the creation of libraries and common assets
Ensure smooth operations through scalable, robust and resilient design of systems
Adopt state of the art technology and cloud-native solutions
Define best practices and standards for application design and development
What we expect from you
University degree in computer science, physics, mathematics or engineering.
2+ years of practical relevant experience in software design and implementation, ideally related to AI systems
In-depth knowledge of Software Engineering best practices, design and architectural patterns.
Experience in object-oriented software development in Python, knowledge of APIs design and implementation - additional languages are a plus.
Practical knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker.
Eager to learn and stay up to date to AI trends, technologies and framework
Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in an agile environment.
Nice to have:
Practical experience in using ML and/or AI frameworks (e.g.
KubeFlow, Langchain, Haystack, ...)
Proven experience in application development leveraging
cloud infrastructure, including cloud services usage and integration¬†
Experience in designing and developing microservices
architecture.
Knowledge
of DevOps best practices, with proven experience of deployments on Kubernetes.
Our offer to you¬†#MakeInnovationHappen: Chance to make an impact in terms of transformation.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Join a young and stimulating environment.
¬†#ComeAsYouAre: Working within a global team.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Play a role of autonomy with high visibility and exposure.
¬†#BalanceLifeAndCareer: Flexible working hours.
¬†#EnjoyTheBest: Access to our Benefits platform with a dedicated budget that you will be able to use to choose the most suitable benefits for you.

About UniCredit GroupUniCredit is a pan-European Commercial Bank with a unique service offering in Italy, Germany, Central and Eastern Europe. Our purpose is to empower communities to progress, delivering the best-in-class for all stakeholders, unlocking a better tomorrow for our clients and our people across Europe. We serve over 15 million customers worldwide. They are at the heart of what we do in all our markets. Digitalisation and our commitment to ESG principles are key enablers for our service. They help us deliver excellence to our stakeholders and creating a sustainable future for our clients, our communities and our people.
We are an equal opportunity employer. We stand together in nurturing a workplace that welcomes diverse thinking and inclusive behaviors.

Making all voices heard and leveraging ""diversity of thought"" regardless of gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, ability, cultural background, we ensure sustainable growth and new business opportunities, a strong drive for innovation and creativity, as well as a general improvement of the work climate with positive impact on productivity, well-being and engagement of our people.

  • Design and development of innovative and cutting-edge AI solutions

  • Adopt state of the art technology and cloud-native solutions

4202532238,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-bip-4202532238?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=RTEQbm5Kl5%2FRluJQ58dlYA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,BIP,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","
Quale sar√† la tua sfida?¬†

Bip ha creato all‚Äôinterno del proprio Competence Centre ‚ÄúxTech‚Äù il pi√π nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall‚ÄôItalia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le proprie sedi estere.¬†

Nell‚Äôambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale presso le realt√† enterprise pi√π importanti d‚ÄôItalia, siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza), sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 5 anni di esperienza). La provenienza da societ√† di consulenza direzionale o informatica sar√† considerata un forte plus.¬†

Il/La Data Scientist in Bip evolve non solo le proprie competenze di AI e Machine Learning, ma anche la comprensione dei fenomeni legati al Business dei nostri Clienti e le proprie capacit√† di tradurli in algoritmi e poi di comunicare e utilizzare i risultati degli stessi per migliorare ed efficientare i processi.¬†

I/Le nostri/e Data Scientist verranno introdotti in contesti progettuali dove comprenderanno le esigenze del Cliente, daranno indicazione ai Data Engineer sulla preparazione desiderata dei dati, sceglieranno o costruiranno i migliori mix di modelli pi√π adatti al caso specifico, discuteranno gli output con il cliente e consegneranno il modello per l‚Äôottimizzazione e passaggio in produzione finale ai Data Engineer.¬†

In contesti pi√π semplificati in cui la componente di Data Engineering √® meno elaborata, i nostri Data Scientist procederanno in autonomia anche nella data preparation e nel porting in produzione dei modelli ingegnerizzati.¬†

Oltre alle progettualit√†, ai/alle Data Scientist sar√† richiesto un contributo attivo per alimentare la Community con attivit√† di ricerca, scouting, concept di nuove soluzioni e business development.¬†
Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro team?¬†
Requisiti Indispensabili:¬†
Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini (STEM)
Forte approccio quantitativo e brillanti doti analitiche
Passione e competenza in ambito data exploration, analisi dati e creazione di modelli: il nostro team disegna e sviluppa sistemi a supporto di decisioni strategiche per il business
Competenze statistiche, di Data Mining, Machine Learning
Solida conoscenza e comprovata esperienza in programmazione e scripting con Python¬†
Conoscenza di tematiche di Deep Learning, NLP e analisi dati non strutturati¬†
Esperienza con strumenti di version control (es. Git)
Comprensione di tecnologie legate ai Big Data come Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark¬†
Conoscenza approfondita di database relazionali e di costrutti SQL e SQL Programming
Conoscenza di database non relazionali¬†
Per profili mid-senior, esperienza comprovata di gestione tecnica delle risorse (persone) su progetto¬†
Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali¬†
Plus:¬†
Conoscenza dei linguaggi PySpark o Scala¬†
Esperienza di lavoro su piattaforma Databricks¬†
Esperienza nello sviluppo di applicazioni di Gen AI¬†

Challenge yourself

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.
Unlocking your potential

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro

Il nostro approccio alla¬†diversit√†¬†e all‚Äôinclusione¬†si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.

Su di Noi
Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.
Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualit√† su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôeccellenza, che √® la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

column2: Bip ha creato all‚Äôinterno del proprio Competence Centre ‚ÄúxTech‚Äù il pi√π nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall‚ÄôItalia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le proprie sedi estere.
column3: Nell‚Äôambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale presso le realt√† enterprise pi√π importanti d‚ÄôItalia, siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza), sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 5 anni di esperienza). 4184363562,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/clinical-research-scientist-chase-at-barrington-james-4184363562?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=bgdBMVHV1TdYSTq8%2BwU43Q%3D%3D,Clinical Research Scientist Chase,Barrington James,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Job Description: CNS Clinical Project Manager
Position: Clinical Project Manager ‚Äì CNS
Location: Milan, Italy
Employment Type: Full-Time
Industry: Biotechnology
Company Overview

Join a well-established and fully funded biotech company at the forefront of central nervous system (CNS) therapeutics. With an innovative pipeline targeting unmet medical needs in neurology and psychiatry, we are expanding our clinical operations team and are seeking a dedicated Clinical Project Manager (CPM) to oversee and drive our CNS clinical trials to success.
Key Responsibilities
Clinical Trial Oversight:
Plan, execute, and manage all phases of CNS clinical trials, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and budget.
Oversee multiple trials simultaneously across international sites, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
Team Leadership:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including regulatory, data management, medical affairs, and external vendors.
Act as the primary point of contact between sponsors, investigators, and site staff to ensure effective communication.
Regulatory & Compliance:
Ensure all trials adhere to ICH-GCP guidelines, company SOPs, and relevant regulatory requirements.
Prepare and review essential regulatory documents and submissions to ethics committees and authorities.
Budget & Resource Management:
Develop, track, and manage clinical trial budgets, contracts, and resources.
Optimize resources to meet trial objectives efficiently.
Vendor and CRO Management:
Select, contract, and oversee third-party vendors, including CROs, ensuring quality deliverables and adherence to timelines.
Conduct regular performance reviews and risk assessments to maintain vendor accountability.
Site Management:
Lead site identification, initiation, and monitoring to ensure high-quality trial conduct.
Address site challenges proactively and implement corrective actions as needed.
Data Integrity and Reporting:
Ensure robust data collection, monitoring, and quality control processes.
Collaborate with biostatistics and data management teams for timely data analysis and reporting.
Required Qualifications
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree in life sciences, pharmacy, or a related field.
Experience:
5+ years in clinical trial/project management, with a strong focus on CNS therapeutic areas.
Proven track record of managing international multi-site trials.
Hands-on experience with all phases of clinical trials, especially Phase I-III.
Skills:
Deep understanding of CNS disorders and their clinical development challenges.
Strong organizational, leadership, and decision-making abilities.
Proficiency in project management tools and systems.
Fluent in English and Italian (both written and verbal).
Preferred Qualifications
Prior experience in biotech or pharmaceutical CNS drug development.
Knowledge of emerging CNS therapies, biomarkers, or advanced trial designs.
Familiarity with Milan‚Äôs clinical research ecosystem and key opinion leaders.
What We Offer
An opportunity to work with a highly skilled and passionate team in a cutting-edge biotech environment.
Competitive salary, benefits, and performance-based incentives.
A collaborative culture fostering innovation and personal growth.
The chance to contribute to life-changing therapies for CNS disorders
