Job Description: CNS Clinical Project Manager

Position: Clinical Project Manager ‚Äì CNS

Location: Milan, Italy

Employment Type: Full-Time

Industry: Biotechnology

Company Overview

Join a well-established and fully funded biotech company at the forefront of central nervous system (CNS) therapeutics. With an innovative pipeline targeting unmet medical needs in neurology and psychiatry, we are expanding our clinical operations team and are seeking a dedicated Clinical Project Manager (CPM) to oversee and drive our CNS clinical trials to success.

Key Responsibilities

  • Clinical Trial Oversight:
    • Plan, execute, and manage all phases of CNS clinical trials, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and budget.
    • Oversee multiple trials simultaneously across international sites, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
  • Team Leadership:
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including regulatory, data management, medical affairs, and external vendors.
    • Act as the primary point of contact between sponsors, investigators, and site staff to ensure effective communication.
  • Regulatory &
column2:
Compliance:
  • Ensure all trials adhere to ICH-GCP guidelines, company SOPs, and relevant regulatory requirements.
  • Prepare and review essential regulatory documents and submissions to ethics committees and authorities.
  • Budget &
column3:
Resource Management:
  • Develop, track, and manage clinical trial budgets, contracts, and resources.
  • Optimize resources to meet trial objectives efficiently.
  • Vendor and CRO Management:
    • Select, contract, and oversee third-party vendors, including CROs, ensuring quality deliverables and adherence to timelines.
    • Conduct regular performance reviews and risk assessments to maintain vendor accountability.
  • Site Management:
    • Lead site identification, initiation, and monitoring to ensure high-quality trial conduct.
    • Address site challenges proactively and implement corrective actions as needed.
  • Data Integrity and Reporting:
    • Ensure robust data collection, monitoring, and quality control processes.
    • Collaborate with biostatistics and data management teams for timely data analysis and reporting.
    Required Qualifications

    • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree in life sciences, pharmacy, or a related field.
    • Experience:
      • 5+ years in clinical trial/project management, with a strong focus on CNS therapeutic areas.
      • Proven track record of managing international multi-site trials.
      • Hands-on experience with all phases of clinical trials, especially Phase I-III.
    • Skills:
      • Deep understanding of CNS disorders and their clinical development challenges.
      • Strong organizational, leadership, and decision-making abilities.
      • Proficiency in project management tools and systems.
      • Fluent in English and Italian (both written and verbal).
    Preferred Qualifications

    • Prior experience in biotech or pharmaceutical CNS drug development.
    • Knowledge of emerging CNS therapies, biomarkers, or advanced trial designs.
    • Familiarity with Milan‚Äôs clinical research ecosystem and key opinion leaders.

    What We Offer

    • An opportunity to work with a highly skilled and passionate team in a cutting-edge biotech environment.
    • Competitive salary, benefits, and performance-based incentives.
    • A collaborative culture fostering innovation and personal growth.
    • The chance to contribute to life-changing therapies for CNS disorders

Octopus Energy Italia üáÆüáπ ‚Äì Data /
Full-time /
Hybrid
Benvenuti nel futuro dell‚Äôenergia!
La missione di Octopus Energy √® rendere l‚Äôenergia rinnovabile accessibile a tutti.
Grazie alla tecnologia, stiamo guidando la rivoluzione energetica a livello globale, offrendo energia pulita a prezzi convenienti e un servizio clienti sbalorditivo.
Se non ti piacciono le sfide non inviarci la tua candidatura
In Octopus Energy non amiamo la burocrazia, le regole troppo stringenti e le offerte commerciali poco chiare.
Vogliamo rivoluzionare il mercato energetico italiano. Per farlo, siamo alla ricerca di persone motivate, che condividano i nostri stessi valori.
Se hai a cuore il futuro del nostro pianeta e vuoi aiutarci a migliorare il settore energetico, unisciti al nostro team!

Con la crescita vertiginosa che stiamo avendo in Octopus, √® emersa la straordinaria opportunit√† di fare la differenza andando a utilizzare in modo intelligente e creativo la grande mole di dati che ogni giorno gestiamo come compagnia energetica. Per fare questo abbiamo quindi deciso di aprire una posizione come Senior Data Scientist.
Cosa farai
Utilizzando le risorse disponibili (e.g. datalake), potrai aiutare i vari team sviluppare modelli/Dashboard/strategie Data driven
Produrrai analisi approfondite dei dati per estrarre insight utili e solidi utili al fine di prendere delle decisioni
Svilupperai la nostra suite di reportistica utilizzando gli strumenti di BI e uno stack tecnologico moderno
Consoliderai e integrerai l'architettura dati alla base dei futuri progetti di analisi
Identificherai proattivamente nuove aree di lavoro e opportunit√† di miglioramento
Comunicherai concetti complessi in modo efficace e con confidenza.
Svilupperai modelli di machine learning a supporto di decisioni complesse
Cosa ti serve
Propensione ad essere curiosi e a farsi domande
Almeno 6 anni di esperienza
Capacit√† di gestione delle priorit√† in un ambiente in rapida crescita
Buona padronanza di alcuni concetti base dell‚Äôambito finance e contabilit√† (attivit√† di rendicontazione, stato patrimoniale, conto economico e simili)
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese
Esperienza pregressa di Python
Conoscenza dei test e delle tecniche statistiche
Buona conoscenza di SQL
Capacit√† di costruire processi ETL e/o di mantenere un Data Lake
Conoscenza del workflow dbt √® considerata un plus
Cos'altro ti piacer√† di noi

Octopus Energy rappresenta una cultura unica: un'organizzazione in cui le persone imparano, prendono decisioni e costruiscono pi√π rapidamente. Dove le persone lavorano con autonomia, accanto a una vasta gamma di co-proprietari straordinari, su progetti che rompono schemi. Vogliamo che il tuo duro lavoro venga premiato con vantaggi che ti interessano davvero!

Ambiente di lavoro flessibile - c'√® un reale equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale qui, ti trattiamo come un essere umano e facciamo del nostro meglio per far convergere il lavoro e la vita in modo armonioso.
Equity Options Scheme - possiedi la tua parte dell'azienda, opzioni di azioni nell'intero Octopus Energy Group: tutti lavoriamo insieme per il successo.
Cultura dell'ufficio - Ogni settimana, il venerd√¨, ci riuniamo tutti (questo avviene anche virtualmente) per gli aggiornamenti aziendali e un brindisi - lo chiamiamo Family Dinner.
Il tuo sviluppo √® importante - supportiamo e aiutiamo con lo sviluppo, inclusi corsi interni ed esterni, apprendimento, supporto allo studio, ecc., tutto su misura per te.

  • Buona conoscenza di SQL
  • Capacit√† di costruire processi ETL e/o di mantenere un Data Lake
  • Conoscenza del workflow dbt √® considerata un plus


Cos'altro ti piacer√† di noi

  • Octopus Energy rappresenta una cultura unica: un'organizzazione in cui le persone imparano, prendono decisioni e costruiscono pi√π rapidamente. Dove le persone lavorano con autonomia, accanto a una vasta gamma di co-proprietari straordinari, su progetti che rompono schemi. Vogliamo che il tuo duro lavoro venga premiato con vantaggi che ti interessano davvero!
  • Ambiente di lavoro flessibile - c'√® un reale equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale qui, ti trattiamo come un essere umano e facciamo del nostro meglio per far convergere il lavoro e la vita in modo armonioso.
  • Equity Options Scheme - possiedi la tua parte dell'azienda, opzioni di azioni nell'intero Octopus Energy Group: tutti lavoriamo insieme per il successo.
  • Cultura dell'ufficio - Ogni settimana, il venerd√¨, ci riuniamo tutti (questo avviene anche virtualmente) per gli aggiornamenti aziendali e un brindisi - lo chiamiamo Family Dinner.
  • Il tuo sviluppo √® importante - supportiamo e aiutiamo con lo sviluppo, inclusi corsi interni ed esterni, apprendimento, supporto allo studio, ecc., tutto su misura per te.

4173786206,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-science-at-ion-4173786206?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wbQ7P6amfrHDUUphkGqh1Q%3D%3D,Internship - Data Science,ION,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.
What You Will Learn During Your Intern
Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive
What You Need To Know
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English
We Are Looking For Someone Who
is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

4196292061,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/innovation-in-ai-at-sdg-group-italy-4196292061?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=uDgITeIudixpFDoiDM1GcQ%3D%3D,Innovation in AI,SDG Group Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","In SDG hai l‚Äôopportunit√† di diventare un esperto di Big Data & Analytics e di entrare a far parte di una delle societ√† pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia d‚ÄôEuropa in questo ambito. Potrai partecipare a diversi progetti nazionali e internazionali lavorando in team giovani e dinamici. Vengono effettuate valutazioni periodiche di performance e acquisizione di skills che ti permetteranno di fare velocemente carriera nella nostra realt√†. Avrai inoltre modo di costruire il tuo career path personalizzato scegliendo tra diversi percorsi. Partendo da un livello base, attraverso training, coaching, mentoring, e un approccio never-stop-learning diventerai un esperto nella progettazione e sviluppo di practices con le quali far adottare ai nostri clienti un‚Äôottica data driven.
Your Challenges:

Acquisire una conoscenza dei big data & analytics a 360¬∞: Lavorare su temi di Innovazione e Ricerca afferenti alla practice di Artificial Intelligence su temi di ‚ÄúDiffusion-based Large Language Models‚Äù e ‚ÄúNeurosymbolic AI‚Äù.
Lavorare guidato dal Chief Data Scientist e Global AI Advisor e inserirsi nel team di Innovazione della Global Practive di AI di SDG.
Sviluppare hard skills nell‚Äôutilizzo delle tecnologie di business intelligence e soft skills per relazionarsi con il cliente e il proprio team di lavoro
Capacit√† di muoversi e interagire in un ambiente internazionale, rapido e dinamico assumendosi gradualmente maggiori responsabilit√† e autonomia nei tasks.
Requirements:
Laureato/a o dottorato/a in Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria Informatica o Matematica e simili.
Conoscenza almeno basilare di SQL, R, Python e delle principali librerie usate per la data science (Numpy, Pandas, Pytorch o TensorFlow)

Team player: un buon giocatore di squadra √® una persona altruista, dinamica, entusiasta, resiliente e positiva. Sono elementi alla base dei Valori SDG e lavoriamo per far crescere una cultura dei valori a tutti i livelli
Capacit√† di elaborare informazioni aziendali complesse e di presentarle con sensibilit√† agli stakeholder aziendali
Conoscenza lingua inglese: B2 (verr√† testata in sede di colloquio).
SDG Group:

Lavorare in SDG significa entrare a far parte di una delle societ√† di management consulting in pi√π rapida crescita nell‚Äôambito dei Business Analytics, Corporate performance Management e Advanced Business Solutions. About The Job

We are seeking a Data Scientist & Analytics Translator to join our Insight and Analytics team in Italy. This role is crucial in bridging the gap between our global AI development teams and local business needs, driving Sanofi‚Äôs digital transformation through the effective application of AI and analytics solutions. Working closely with both global and local teams, you'll translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations, enabling data-driven decision-making in our commercial operations.
Main Responsibilities
Review and validate the application of algorithms based on business needs.
Produce reports and analyze AI results to identify potential areas for improvement.
Explain AI results to stakeholders and support change management to promote digital transformation.
Assess and validate data availability and data quality for various use cases.
Help the global development in the design of new AI use cases.
Facilitate communication between business teams and technical/development teams: help business teams understand AI solutions and gather their input
column2: assist technical teams in understanding local business needs and data considerations.

column1: Collaborate with local teams to define data solutions and business reporting.
About You
Experience: relevant experience in data science, analytics, or related field.

Soft and technical skills: Excellent communication skills with the ability to tell compelling stories through data, a good knowledge of SQL and PowerBI, Python knowledge is a plus, strong understanding of data science algorithms and ability to explain their functionality, knowledge of data pipelines and data quality management principles.
Education: Master‚Äôs degree in any STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) field.
Why choose us?
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it‚Äôs through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.

Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and well being benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and weeks‚Äô gender-neutral parental leave.

4197900687,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-expert-at-outlier-4197900687?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=8kvRN5DDjP2hhnb8UjlvmA%3D%3D,Data Science Expert,Outlier,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Outlier helps the world‚Äôs most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced data science engineer who wants to lend your expertise to train AI models? Join our team of experts to train AI models for data science generation!

We partner with organizations to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models improve their output. Projects typically involve predictive modeling, classification, clustering, optimization, a/b testing, and/or anomaly detection that require interacting with these models as they learn. No previous AI experience is required.
About The Opportunity
Outlier is looking for talented Data Scientists to help train generative artificial intelligence models.
This freelance opportunity is remote with flexible hours, so you can work whenever is best for you. The general expectation is 30-40 hours of availability per week.
You Can Contribute With Your Expertise By
Developing and answering data science questions to help train AI models
Evaluating and classifying responses generated by AI models
Examples Of Experience
Currently pursuing or having completed a bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Data Science from a selective institution.
Proficiency in working with Data Science
Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in written and spoken English.
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.
If you already have an Outlier account, please apply here:
https://forms.gle/God6XYypiSpAxvrd6
Please apply only if you meet the required skills and have a strong interest in the role.

PLEASE NOTE: We collect, store, and use personal data for our business purposes, including notifying you about opportunities that may be of interest to you and sharing it with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to what we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage the needs of applicants, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect related to your application will be handled in accordance with Outlier's Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Since this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to register with Outlier if you have a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor for specific questions about your circumstances.

Competenze specifiche richieste:

Feature Engineering: Competenza nella selezione e trasformazione delle caratteristiche dei dati per migliorare la performance dei modelli.
Cosa offriamo:

4194955019,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/back-end-developer-python-%2B-ai-ml-at-edgemony-4194955019?position=58&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=JK3X49Hsf33nbKBqg%2BLOYw%3D%3D,Back-End Developer (Python + AI/ML),Edgemony,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo Edgemony, un'azienda nata come realt√† di training, che si √® specializzata nella creazione di un hub tecnologico in Sicilia e nel supportare i clienti nella selezione e formazione dei loro team.

Per il nostro cliente FULLTRUCK, siamo alla ricerca di un/una Back-End Developer con focus su Python, che abbia voglia di contribuire alla costruzione di sistemi intelligenti in grado di rivoluzionare il business della logistica.
About FullTruck

FullTruck √® una tech company nel settore della logistica con una missione chiara: eliminare i viaggi a vuoto nel trasporto merci. Ogni giorno migliaia di camion viaggiano senza carico ‚Äî un'enorme inefficienza economica ed ecologica. Noi vogliamo risolvere questo problema assicurando che ogni vettore riceva il carico giusto, al momento giusto.

Per farlo, stiamo sviluppando una piattaforma che combina data engineering, AI e sistemi di raccomandazione per ottimizzare il matching tra carichi e trasportatori. Al centro di tutto questo ci sono agenti AI capaci di ragionare, decidere e comunicare con i vettori su canali come WhatsApp, email o telefono.
Cosa farai
Progetterai servizi e moduli backend per alimentare i nostri agenti AI
Collaborerai alla creazione di un sistema di raccomandazione che apprende dalle preferenze, comportamenti e contesto logistico
Lavorerai su sistemi scalabili e asincroni, con particolare attenzione alla performance in presenza di milioni di record
Parteciperai alla progettazione di nuove architetture backend per abilitare interazioni uomo-macchina intelligenti e fluide
Collaborerai con il CPO, il team di prodotto e il team frontend per portare nuove funzionalit√† in produzione rapidamente
Requirements
Hai almeno 3 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo backend
Hai una conoscenza approfondita di Python e dimestichezza con FastAPI, SQLAlchemy e PostgreSQL
Hai esperienza nello sviluppo di API REST performanti e sistemi orientati alla scalabilit√†
Hai esperienza pratica o forte interesse negli agenti AI, LLM, sistemi di raccomandazione o architetture multi-agente
Ti entusiasma lavorare su problemi complessi con soluzioni eleganti, robuste e ben documentate
Sei autonomo/a, curioso/a, ma anche capace di lavorare in squadra in modo collaborativo
Nice to have
Esperienza concreta nello sviluppo o orchestrazione di agenti AI (es. OpenAI/Gemini agents, LangChain, RAG, etc)
Esperienza con task queue, event-driven architecture, sistemi distribuiti
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza del dominio logistico o interesse verso le dinamiche del mondo dei trasporti
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese
Benefits
L'opportunit√† di contribuire alla trasformazione di un intero settore, in modo concreto
Un ambiente dinamico e collaborativo, dove sperimentare √® la norma
Crescita professionale attraverso mentoring e formazione continua
Modalit√† di lavoro full remote, con incontri di persona circa 1-2 volte al mese (Torino, Milano, Genova)

Siamo Edgemony, un'azienda nata come realt√† di training, che si √® specializzata nella creazione di un hub tecnologico in Sicilia e nel supportare i clienti nella selezione e formazione dei loro team.

Per il nostro cliente FULLTRUCK, siamo alla ricerca di un/una Back-End Developer con focus su Python, che abbia voglia di contribuire alla costruzione di sistemi intelligenti in grado di rivoluzionare il business della logistica.

About FullTruck

FullTruck √® una tech company nel settore della logistica con una missione chiara: eliminare i viaggi a vuoto nel trasporto merci. Ogni giorno migliaia di camion viaggiano senza carico ‚Äî un'enorme inefficienza economica ed ecologica. Noi vogliamo risolvere questo problema assicurando che ogni vettore riceva il carico giusto, al momento giusto.

Per farlo, stiamo sviluppando una piattaforma che combina data engineering, AI e sistemi di raccomandazione per ottimizzare il matching tra carichi e trasportatori. Al centro di tutto questo ci sono agenti AI capaci di ragionare, decidere e comunicare con i vettori su canali come WhatsApp, email o telefono.

Cosa farai

  • Progetterai servizi e moduli backend per alimentare i nostri agenti AI
  • Collaborerai alla creazione di un sistema di raccomandazione che apprende dalle preferenze, comportamenti e contesto logistico
  • Lavorerai su sistemi scalabili e asincroni, con particolare attenzione alla performance in presenza di milioni di record
  • Parteciperai alla progettazione di nuove architetture backend per abilitare interazioni uomo-macchina intelligenti e fluide
  • Collaborerai con il CPO, il team di prodotto e il team frontend per portare nuove funzionalit√† in produzione rapidamente


Requirements

  • Hai almeno 3 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo backend
  • Hai una conoscenza approfondita di Python e dimestichezza con FastAPI, SQLAlchemy e PostgreSQL
  • Hai esperienza nello sviluppo di API REST performanti e sistemi orientati alla scalabilit√†
  • Hai esperienza pratica o forte interesse negli agenti AI, LLM, sistemi di raccomandazione o architetture multi-agente
  • Ti entusiasma lavorare su problemi complessi con soluzioni eleganti, robuste e ben documentate
  • Sei autonomo/a, curioso/a, ma anche capace di lavorare in squadra in modo collaborativo


Nice to have

  • Esperienza concreta nello sviluppo o orchestrazione di agenti AI (es. OpenAI/Gemini agents, LangChain, RAG, etc)
  • Esperienza con task queue, event-driven architecture, sistemi distribuiti
  • Laurea in discipline STEM
  • Conoscenza del dominio logistico o interesse verso le dinamiche del mondo dei trasporti
  • Buona conoscenza dell'inglese


Benefits

  • L'opportunit√† di contribuire alla trasformazione di un intero settore, in modo concreto
  • Un ambiente dinamico e collaborativo, dove sperimentare √® la norma
  • Crescita professionale attraverso mentoring e formazione continua
  • Modalit√† di lavoro full remote, con incontri di persona circa 1-2 volte al mese (Torino, Milano, Genova)
  • RAL: 40.000‚Ç¨ - 45.000‚Ç¨

4211380180,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-dario-franzosi-4211380180?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=E4dzzQ9Clue9Q3zoLaybZQ%3D%3D&trackingId=zO1Yq6ALrhWfp1VYtmk8Pw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Dario Franzosi,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Stiamo selezionando un o una Data Scientist per il team di Marketing Analytics di un'a scale up di Milano, specializzata nella creazione di prodotti tecnologici basati su Intelligenza Artificiale, Advanced Analytics e Computer Vision.
Questo ruolo prevede la gestione e il monitoraggio delle campagne marketing (Apple Search Ads, Google Ads, Meta e TikTok), applicando un approccio automatizzato e guidato dai dati.
Offerta:
Contratto a tempo indeterminato
RAL fino a 40K + variabile in funzione dell‚Äôesperienza e delle competenze emerse in sede di colloquio
Smart working ibrido 2/3 gg a settimana
Orario flessibile e cultura aziendale orientata agli obiettivi
La possibilit√† di lavorare su applicazioni mobile che contano pi√π di tre milioni di download al mese negli store Apple e Google Play e sul web
Budget mensile per corsi di formazione
In qualit√† di Data Scientist nel settore performance marketing, la persona inserita nel team si occuper√† di:

Modelli di apprendimento automatico: Utilizzer√† strumenti avanzati di machine learning per sviluppare modelli che prevedano il ROAS delle campagne di marketing, facilitando un processo decisionale pi√π informato.

Sviluppo della strategia: Definire e implementare, insieme ai responsabili marketing, nuove strategie per la gestione delle campagne marketing, concentrandosi sull'innovazione e sull'efficienza per favorire la crescita del business.
Sviluppo dell'infrastruttura: Sviluppare e migliorare l'infrastruttura di backend per automatizzare i vari aspetti delle campagne marketing, compresa l'allocazione del budget e i test delle campagne.

Automazione e attribuzione: Gestione automatizzata delle campagne su piattaforme come Apple Search Ads, Google Ads, Meta e TikTok. Sviluppare sistemi per attribuire gli utenti ai diversi canali in modo efficace.

Gestione delle campagne: Supervisionare, a fianco del responsabile marketing, la gestione e il monitoraggio delle campagne marketing per garantire il successo e l'efficienza. Utilizzare analisi avanzate per valutare le prestazioni delle campagne e prendere decisioni basate sui dati.
Allocazione del budget: Allocare il budget per le campagne marketing tra i diversi canali in modo da massimizzare il ritorno sulla spesa pubblicitaria (ROAS) e raggiungere gli obiettivi di marketing.
Requisiti:
Laurea in Ingegneria, Economia / Data Science, Matematica, Fisica, o una disciplina scientifica correlata
Almeno 1 anno di esperienza in attivit√† di analisi dati o data science
Competenze avanzate in Python:
Competenza in Machine Learning
Pensiero analitico: Eccezionali capacit√† analitiche e di problem solving, con abilit√† di interpretare dati complessi e di trasformare le intuizioni in azioni concrete
Capacit√† comunicative: Ottime capacit√† comunicative e di coordinamento per collaborare efficacemente con diversi team e stakeholder
Innovazione: Mentalit√† proattiva e innovativa, con attenzione al miglioramento continuo e all'adozione di nuove tecnologie per migliorare le capacit√† di analisi di marketing

Il nostro compito √® quello di affiancarci al candidato per trovare la soluzione lavorativa migliore per questo ti presenteremo sempre il lavoro in modo trasparente ed onesto (anche perch√® perdere tempo non serve a nessuno)
Se hai domande scrivici in privato!

4156636617,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-llm-model-at-lutech-4156636617?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=DaOMYr5a%2BzWWhmPJbgaKjA%3D%3D&trackingId=HQuTA6lhrWeomKrwNlrm8Q%3D%3D,Data Scientist - LLM model,Lutech,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","The Digital Evolution Company Of Today And Tomorrow

Progettiamo soluzioni end-to-end per la Digital Evolution gestendone ogni area, grazie alle nostre sei anime tecnologiche: LutechConsulting, LutechSolutions, LutechDigital, LutechCybersecurity, LutechServices e LutechCloud.

In Lutech potrai operare all‚Äôinterno di una vera community tecnologica, che contribuirai a far crescere e a migliorare con le tue competenze. Troverai un ambiente inclusivo e informale in cui nessuno √® un numero e tutti siamo un valore. Diamo importanza alla diversit√† riconoscendo che la forza di un team risiede nelle esperienze, prospettive e background unici che ogni persona porta con s√©.
Posizione
Come Data scientist, nella nostra practice Data analytics, sarai coinvolto in attivit√† di sviluppo e integrazione di modelli LLM.
In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di

4183360108,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-global-teams-at-prima-4183360108?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=DaOMYr5a%2BzWWhmPJbgaKjA%3D%3D&trackingId=EGG3Fk66laJJD1Y1fT1%2BYw%3D%3D,Data Scientist - Global Teams,Prima,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Got the drive to shape the future of insurance?
At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career
column2: learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

column1: Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.
You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on well-being, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.
ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.
üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities
We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column2: so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

column1: üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.
If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

At Prima, Data Scientists are part of the Pricing & Underwriting department , working within global teams that drive our international strategy. By applying for this role, you'll be considered for one of two global teams, and during the hiring process, we'll determine the best fit for your skills and expertise.

Our Global Pricing & Underwriting Teams are at the forefront of shaping our international strategy through data, analytics, and innovation. They transform complexity into structured, proactive solutions, enabling each market to identify opportunities for improvement and drive continuous growth.

By combining strategic vision with cutting-edge analytics, the team ensures a seamless approach to pricing and underwriting. Their work spans from defining and executing global strategies to developing advanced machine learning models and optimizing data pipelines. Through collaboration across multiple markets, they extract insights, identify scalable best practices, and enhance technical capabilities, making data-driven decision-making a core strength of Prima.
This unified approach empowers us to stay ahead in a dynamic industry, leveraging data and expertise to drive innovation, efficiency, and sustainable success. üöÄ
Join us and be part of a global team pushing the boundaries of Pricing & Underwriting through data.
As a Data Scientist in these teams, some of your activities could be

Design, build and evolve Prima‚Äôs proprietary predictive technology, in topics such as the prediction of future claims, tactical pricing, renewal probability, fraud detection and customer lifetime value, etc

Define and support the implementation in each country of the key tools to understand how the business is growing, for example, conversion, retention, emerging profitability. The monitoring tools need to be consistent at a global level and at the same time able to adapt to the different stages of evolution of each country
Support the countries in planning the pricing and UW strategy and consequent follow up
Develop a strong critical spirit and creativity that can act as an engine for Prima's growth.
Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for
Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Computer science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematical Engineering or Physical Engineering
From graduates to people with 2+ years of working/research experience: we‚Äôre open to evaluate the seniority during the recruitment process
Strong Python programming skills - especially in the data domain - and fluent use of GIT
Excellent English level, oral & written
You have a genuine, collaborative mindset that inspires and guides others.
In addition to the basic requirements, we will carefully evaluate these characteristics as a plus
You have previous work experience in similar roles
Knowledge of Spark, SQL or any other data-oriented programming language and proficiency with standard data wrangling and modeling libraries (Pandas, Sklearn. Keras, XGBboost, LightGBM, etc.)
Knowledge of BI tools (Tableau or similar)

Strong background in mathematical optimization, linear and nonlinear programming, convex optimization, combinatorial optimization techniques, metaheuristics (such as genetic algorithms, simulated annealing, and particle swarm optimization), and stochastic optimization methods.

Remember, research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

Their work spans from defining and executing global strategies to developing advanced machine learning models and optimizing data pipelines. Through collaboration across multiple markets, they extract insights, identify scalable best practices, and enhance technical capabilities, making data-driven decision-making a core strength of Prima.

This unified approach empowers us to stay ahead in a dynamic industry, leveraging data and expertise to drive innovation, efficiency, and sustainable success. üöÄ

Join us and be part of a global team pushing the boundaries of Pricing &
column6:
Underwriting through data.

As a Data Scientist in these teams, some of your activities could be

  • Design, build and evolve Prima‚Äôs proprietary predictive technology, in topics such as the prediction of future claims, tactical pricing, renewal probability, fraud detection and customer lifetime value, etc
column7: • Define and support the implementation in each country of the key tools to understand how the business is growing, for example, conversion, retention, emerging profitability. The monitoring tools need to be consistent at a global level and at the same time able to adapt to the different stages of evolution of each country
column8: • Support the countries in planning the pricing and UW strategy and consequent follow up
column9:
• Develop a strong critical spirit and creativity that can act as an engine for Prima's growth.

    • Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for

    • Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Computer science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematical Engineering or Physical Engineering
column10: • From graduates to people with 2+ years of working/research experience: we‚Äôre open to evaluate the seniority during the recruitment process
column11: • Strong Python programming skills - especially in the data domain - and fluent use of GIT
column12: • Excellent English level, oral &
column13: written
column14:
• You have a genuine, collaborative mindset that inspires and guides others.

    • In addition to the basic requirements, we will carefully evaluate these characteristics as a plus

    • You have previous work experience in similar roles
column15: • Knowledge of Spark, SQL or any other data-oriented programming language and proficiency with standard data wrangling and modeling libraries (Pandas, Sklearn. Keras, XGBboost, LightGBM, etc.)
column16: • Knowledge of BI tools (Tableau or similar)
column17:
• Strong background in mathematical optimization, linear and nonlinear programming, convex optimization, combinatorial optimization techniques, metaheuristics (such as genetic algorithms, simulated annealing, and particle swarm optimization), and stochastic optimization methods.

    • Remember, research shows that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. At Prima we are committed to building diverse teams so please apply even if your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with the requirements. You might still be a great fit!

    Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

4149023507,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-scientist-intern-at-integral-ad-science-4149023507?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=DaOMYr5a%2BzWWhmPJbgaKjA%3D%3D&trackingId=i3FbvYtNHr3aa3wfE0X%2BYA%3D%3D,Machine Learning Scientist Intern,Integral Ad Science,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3: and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

column1: As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.
What you‚Äôll get to do:

Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).

Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.
You should apply if you have most of this experience:
Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.
About Integral Ad Science

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.
Equal Opportunity Employer:

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.
California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.
To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.
Show more ","<div class=""description__text description__text--rich"">
<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3:
and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.

What you‚Äôll get to do:

  • Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).
  • Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
  • Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
  • Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.


You should apply if you have most of this experience:

  • Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
  • Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
  • Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
  • Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.


About Integral Ad Science

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.

To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

4210835778,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-at-unicredit-4210835778?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=DaOMYr5a%2BzWWhmPJbgaKjA%3D%3D&trackingId=%2B1EyeVvHh5GBqCIyeLvn3w%3D%3D,AI Engineer,UniCredit,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We are looking for an AI engineer to join our AI factory team. You will be responsible for E2E applications development leveraging AI and generative AI capabilities. Your goal will be to design and implement scalable AI systems built around deep learning and machine learning models as well as large language models.
You will collaborate in a dynamic and innovative context in close collaboration with Architects, Data Scientists and Business Translators.What you can expect from us
Design and development of innovative and cutting-edge AI solutions
Contribute to the scale-up of AI adoption through the creation of libraries and common assets
Ensure smooth operations through scalable, robust and resilient design of systems
Adopt state of the art technology and cloud-native solutions
Define best practices and standards for application design and development
What we expect from you
University degree in computer science, physics, mathematics or engineering.
2+ years of practical relevant experience in software design and implementation, ideally related to AI systems
In-depth knowledge of Software Engineering best practices, design and architectural patterns.
Experience in object-oriented software development in Python, knowledge of APIs design and implementation - additional languages are a plus.
Practical knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker.
Eager to learn and stay up to date to AI trends, technologies and framework
Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in an agile environment.
Nice to have:
Practical experience in using ML and/or AI frameworks (e.g.
KubeFlow, Langchain, Haystack, ...)
Proven experience in application development leveraging
cloud infrastructure, including cloud services usage and integration¬†
Experience in designing and developing microservices
architecture.
Knowledge
of DevOps best practices, with proven experience of deployments on Kubernetes.
Our offer to you¬†#MakeInnovationHappen: Chance to make an impact in terms of transformation.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Join a young and stimulating environment.
¬†#ComeAsYouAre: Working within a global team.
¬†#UnlockYourPotential: Play a role of autonomy with high visibility and exposure.
¬†#BalanceLifeAndCareer: Flexible working hours.
¬†#EnjoyTheBest: Access to our Benefits platform with a dedicated budget that you will be able to use to choose the most suitable benefits for you.

About UniCredit GroupUniCredit is a pan-European Commercial Bank with a unique service offering in Italy, Germany, Central and Eastern Europe. Our purpose is to empower communities to progress, delivering the best-in-class for all stakeholders, unlocking a better tomorrow for our clients and our people across Europe. We serve over 15 million customers worldwide. They are at the heart of what we do in all our markets. Digitalisation and our commitment to ESG principles are key enablers for our service. They help us deliver excellence to our stakeholders and creating a sustainable future for our clients, our communities and our people.
We are an equal opportunity employer. We stand together in nurturing a workplace that welcomes diverse thinking and inclusive behaviors.

Making all voices heard and leveraging ""diversity of thought"" regardless of gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, ability, cultural background, we ensure sustainable growth and new business opportunities, a strong drive for innovation and creativity, as well as a general improvement of the work climate with positive impact on productivity, well-being and engagement of our people.

<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

We are looking for an AI engineer to join our AI factory team. You will be responsible for E2E applications development leveraging AI and generative AI capabilities. Your goal will be to design and implement scalable AI systems built around deep learning and machine learning models as well as large language models.
You will collaborate in a dynamic and innovative context in close collaboration with Architects, Data Scientists and Business Translators.What you can expect from us
  • Design and development of innovative and cutting-edge AI solutions
  • Contribute to the scale-up of AI adoption through the creation of libraries and common assets
  • Ensure smooth operations through scalable, robust and resilient design of systems
  • Adopt state of the art technology and cloud-native solutions
  • Define best practices and standards for application design and development
What we expect from you
  • University degree in computer science, physics, mathematics or engineering.
  • 2+ years of practical relevant experience in software design and implementation, ideally related to AI systems
  • In-depth knowledge of Software Engineering best practices, design and architectural patterns.
  • Experience in object-oriented software development in Python, knowledge of APIs design and implementation - additional languages are a plus.
  • Practical knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker.
  • Eager to learn and stay up to date to AI trends, technologies and framework
  • Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in an agile environment.
Nice to have:

  • Practical experience in using ML and/or AI frameworks (e.g.
    KubeFlow, Langchain, Haystack, ...)
  • Proven experience in application development leveraging
    cloud infrastructure, including cloud services usage and integration

• Experience in designing and developing microservices
    architecture.
  • Knowledge

4208214211,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-junior-pricing-at-allianz-direct-4208214211?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=DaOMYr5a%2BzWWhmPJbgaKjA%3D%3D&trackingId=OWWQZSWVGOUT2PRzwtAOaw%3D%3D,DATA SCIENTIST JUNIOR -PRICING,Allianz Direct,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Job Purpose/Role
The candidate would be required to provide support to Actuarial Modelling unit carrying out the following activities:
Data collection and preparation for further analysis and modelling
Develop and update statistical models for Motor products using advanced statistical techniques like GLM and Machine learning approach
Analysis of classification based on technical features
Demand models with application of different algorithms
Tariff definition/revision based on evidence from statistical models
Assessment on a regular basis of the quality and correctness of the models
Data exploration to improve model predictiveness
Update of the portfolio analysis with the main Kpis to monitor the acquired portfolio
Data processing to support standard portfolio or ad hoc simulation and monitoring analysis.
Key Requirements/Skills/Experience
Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial, Physics or Computer Science
Sas\Sql, Python
Office
Strong analysis, problem-solving, and communication skills
Curious about new approaches and committed to continually increase technical knowledge
Team spirit, self-motivation, and a proactive result-driven working style as well as ability to interact in a global work environment with people from different countries and cultures.
Fluent in Italian and English

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

Job Purpose/Role

The candidate would be required to provide support to Actuarial Modelling unit carrying out the following activities:

  • Data collection and preparation for further analysis and modelling
  • Develop and update statistical models for Motor products using advanced statistical techniques like GLM and Machine learning approach
  • Analysis of classification based on technical features
  • Demand models with application of different algorithms
  • Tariff definition/revision based on evidence from statistical models
  • Assessment on a regular basis of the quality and correctness of the models
  • Data exploration to improve model predictiveness
  • Update of the portfolio analysis with the main Kpis to monitor the acquired portfolio
  • Data processing to support standard portfolio or ad hoc simulation and monitoring analysis.

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

  • Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial, Physics or Computer Science
  • Sas\Sql, Python
  • Office
  • Strong analysis, problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Curious about new approaches and committed to continually increase technical knowledge
  • Team spirit, self-motivation, and a proactive result-driven working style as well as ability to interact in a global work environment with people from different countries and cultures.
  • Fluent in Italian and English

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

‚óè Capacit√† di collaborare in team e di raggiungere obiettivi ambiziosi.

‚óè Spirito creativo e orientato al raggiungimento degli obiettivi.


Chi siamo

Contrader √® una societ√† con esperienza pluriennale in ambito ICT, esperta nella realizzazione di progetti e nella consulenza aziendale ad altissima specializzazione nel settore ICT e nello sviluppo di componenti software. Abbiamo la ferma convinzione che la crescita aziendale sia strettamente legata alla capacit√† di anticipare i cambiamenti, esplorando strade e idee innovative. La nostra missione va infatti oltre l'offerta di soluzioni immediate e miriamo a creare risorse altamente qualificate per il futuro.


Per maggiori informazioni consulta il nostro sito: https://contrader.it/

4205660228,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-analytics-translator-at-sanofi-4205660228?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=VZB98HpTVrZRxdHufuVBCw%3D%3D&trackingId=Wo1uTP6nhXG1tAzx2VCuZg%3D%3D,Data Scientist & Analytics Translator,Sanofi,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Location: Milan - Italy
About The Job

We are seeking a Data Scientist & Analytics Translator to join our Insight and Analytics team in Italy. This role is crucial in bridging the gap between our global AI development teams and local business needs, driving Sanofi‚Äôs digital transformation through the effective application of AI and analytics solutions. Working closely with both global and local teams, you'll translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations, enabling data-driven decision-making in our commercial operations.
Main Responsibilities
Review and validate the application of algorithms based on business needs.
Produce reports and analyze AI results to identify potential areas for improvement.
Explain AI results to stakeholders and support change management to promote digital transformation.
Assess and validate data availability and data quality for various use cases.
Help the global development in the design of new AI use cases.
Facilitate communication between business teams and technical/development teams: help business teams understand AI solutions and gather their input
column2: assist technical teams in understanding local business needs and data considerations.

column1: Collaborate with local teams to define data solutions and business reporting.
About You
Experience: relevant experience in data science, analytics, or related field.

Soft and technical skills: Excellent communication skills with the ability to tell compelling stories through data, a good knowledge of SQL and PowerBI, Python knowledge is a plus, strong understanding of data science algorithms and ability to explain their functionality, knowledge of data pipelines and data quality management principles.
Education: Master‚Äôs degree in any STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) field.
Why choose us?
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it‚Äôs through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.

Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and well being benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and weeks‚Äô gender-neutral parental leave.

4211380180,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-dario-franzosi-4211380180?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=VZB98HpTVrZRxdHufuVBCw%3D%3D&trackingId=IsCaRVTjHoiAkZWwE8lNAA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Dario Franzosi,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Stiamo selezionando un o una Data Scientist per il team di Marketing Analytics di un'a scale up di Milano, specializzata nella creazione di prodotti tecnologici basati su Intelligenza Artificiale, Advanced Analytics e Computer Vision.
Questo ruolo prevede la gestione e il monitoraggio delle campagne marketing (Apple Search Ads, Google Ads, Meta e TikTok), applicando un approccio automatizzato e guidato dai dati.
Offerta:
Contratto a tempo indeterminato
RAL fino a 40K + variabile in funzione dell‚Äôesperienza e delle competenze emerse in sede di colloquio
Smart working ibrido 2/3 gg a settimana
Orario flessibile e cultura aziendale orientata agli obiettivi
La possibilit√† di lavorare su applicazioni mobile che contano pi√π di tre milioni di download al mese negli store Apple e Google Play e sul web
Budget mensile per corsi di formazione
In qualit√† di Data Scientist nel settore performance marketing, la persona inserita nel team si occuper√† di:

Modelli di apprendimento automatico: Utilizzer√† strumenti avanzati di machine learning per sviluppare modelli che prevedano il ROAS delle campagne di marketing, facilitando un processo decisionale pi√π informato.

Sviluppo della strategia: Definire e implementare, insieme ai responsabili marketing, nuove strategie per la gestione delle campagne marketing, concentrandosi sull'innovazione e sull'efficienza per favorire la crescita del business.
Sviluppo dell'infrastruttura: Sviluppare e migliorare l'infrastruttura di backend per automatizzare i vari aspetti delle campagne marketing, compresa l'allocazione del budget e i test delle campagne.

Automazione e attribuzione: Gestione automatizzata delle campagne su piattaforme come Apple Search Ads, Google Ads, Meta e TikTok. Sviluppare sistemi per attribuire gli utenti ai diversi canali in modo efficace.

Gestione delle campagne: Supervisionare, a fianco del responsabile marketing, la gestione e il monitoraggio delle campagne marketing per garantire il successo e l'efficienza. Utilizzare analisi avanzate per valutare le prestazioni delle campagne e prendere decisioni basate sui dati.
Allocazione del budget: Allocare il budget per le campagne marketing tra i diversi canali in modo da massimizzare il ritorno sulla spesa pubblicitaria (ROAS) e raggiungere gli obiettivi di marketing.
Requisiti:
Laurea in Ingegneria, Economia / Data Science, Matematica, Fisica, o una disciplina scientifica correlata
Almeno 1 anno di esperienza in attivit√† di analisi dati o data science
Competenze avanzate in Python:
Competenza in Machine Learning
Pensiero analitico: Eccezionali capacit√† analitiche e di problem solving, con abilit√† di interpretare dati complessi e di trasformare le intuizioni in azioni concrete
Capacit√† comunicative: Ottime capacit√† comunicative e di coordinamento per collaborare efficacemente con diversi team e stakeholder
Innovazione: Mentalit√† proattiva e innovativa, con attenzione al miglioramento continuo e all'adozione di nuove tecnologie per migliorare le capacit√† di analisi di marketing

Il nostro compito √® quello di affiancarci al candidato per trovare la soluzione lavorativa migliore per questo ti presenteremo sempre il lavoro in modo trasparente ed onesto (anche perch√® perdere tempo non serve a nessuno)
Se hai domande scrivici in privato!

4193451523,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-at-nebuly-4193451523?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=VZB98HpTVrZRxdHufuVBCw%3D%3D&trackingId=pw3FeOcO9%2ByjR%2BDBvvI8tQ%3D%3D,AI Engineer,Nebuly,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Join our mission

Nebuly AI is a well-funded, fast-growing VC-backed startup in the emerging AI sector. Nebuly is not only pioneering but defining a new market category: LLMs user analytics. Recognizing the immense potential of Generative AI, we are ambitiously charting unexplored territories, crafting a unique niche that no company has ventured into before.

Thanks to Nebuly, companies can automatically capture how users interact with their LLM-powered chatbots / agents. Our platform is key to understand what LLM users like, what they don‚Äôt and why, what are the most asked questions and how you can create personalised LLMs responses to delight your customers.

Despite our youthful journey, demand for our product is skyrocketing, and our robust funding ensures we're poised for strong growth. Our team is a collective of forward-thinkers, committed to transforming industries with revolutionary AI products.
We offer not only very competitive salaries, but also the opportunity to shape the AI landscape.
If you‚Äôre a skilled Python engineer with strong knowledge of AI systems, we want you.
Examples of your daily responsibilities

As an AI Engineer, you will oversee data labeling processes and ensure the quality and consistency of training datasets critical to model performance. You will fine-tune proprietary large language models (LLMs) utilizing cloud-based GPU infrastructure, optimizing model accuracy and efficiency for specific business applications. Additionally, you‚Äôll be responsible for integrating model outputs seamlessly into the broader platform, collaborating closely with software engineers to ensure robust deployment and optimal functionality. Your responsibilities will include:
Oversight data labeling and training data quality
Fine-tune proprietary LLM models on cloud GPUs
Integrate the model outputs with the rest of the platform
Oversight on model output quality with both automatic tools and human supervision
Develop PoCs for AI features and once completed integrate them into production
What we look for
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in training and evaluating Neural Networks, with a particular emphasis on NLP tasks.
Experience in training large deep learning models on multiple GPUs
Professional experience in using Python and common deep learning frameworks as PyTorch, HuggingFace Transformers and vLLM.
Strong knowledge and experience with microservices architecture and building scalable systems.
Strong knowledge of PostgresSQL and experience in working with ORMs like SQLAlchemy.
Proficiency in designing and implementing RESTful APIs.
Strong knowledge and experience with testing practices and frameworks, such as unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing, using libraries like Pytest.
Understanding of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.
What we offer

High-impact work in small, fast-moving teams. At Nebuly, you‚Äôll work in small, entrepreneurial teams with a high degree of ownership and autonomy. Regardless of your seniority, your contributions will have a direct impact‚Äîfrom the earliest ideas to product launch. You‚Äôll have the chance to build things from scratch and see your code evolve into real products used at scale.

A platform for real growth. As more and more companies rely on our platform to understand and optimize their AI experiences, new challenges and opportunities emerge constantly. This means your role won‚Äôt stay static‚Äîyou‚Äôll keep growing with the product, facing new technical and strategic problems as we scale.

Competitive compensation & stock options. We offer a competitive salary, tailored to your experience and location. In addition, you‚Äôll have access to stock options so you can share in the value we‚Äôre creating together.

Remote-friendly & flexible. We believe great work doesn‚Äôt have to happen in a fixed place or on a fixed schedule. We‚Äôre remote-friendly, offer flexible working hours, and support you in setting up the conditions to do your best work‚Äîwherever you are.
The selection process
For most roles at Nebuly, here‚Äôs what our hiring process typically looks like:

Introductory Call (30min): You‚Äôll first speak with the person who initially contacted you or the hiring coordinator for the role. This is an informal chat where we‚Äôd love to learn more about you‚Äîwhat brought you to apply, your interests, and what excites you. We were impressed by your profile and want to give you space to ask questions and get a better sense of what we do at Nebuly. üó£ All conversation are held in English.

Conversation with Your Future Manager (30min): Next, you‚Äôll meet the person you‚Äôd be directly reporting to. This call dives deeper into the role: the day-to-day responsibilities, challenges, and what success looks like. For technical roles, this will include a practical or coding interview.
Logic Challenge (30min): A test with logic-based questions. This helps us understand how you approach unfamiliar problems.

Behavioral Test (30min): You‚Äôll complete a short online behavioral assessment. This isn‚Äôt about right or wrong answers‚Äîit‚Äôs designed to give us insight into your working style, how you collaborate, and what kind of environment helps you do your best work. It also helps us ensure strong alignment between you and the culture at Nebuly.

Meeting the Co-founders (30min): If you‚Äôve reached this step, things are looking great. You‚Äôll meet Nebuly‚Äôs co-founders to talk about your motivations, career goals, and what makes you thrive at work. It‚Äôs also your chance to get to know the people shaping the vision of the company.

Role-Focused Project (2 hrs): At this stage, we‚Äôre genuinely excited about the possibility of working together. We‚Äôll propose a short project that reflects the kind of work you‚Äôd actually be doing at Nebuly. You‚Äôll have full flexibility on timing‚Äîwe‚Äôll work around your schedule to make sure it‚Äôs manageable and enjoyable.

Deep-Dive Technical Session (1hr): This is a second round of technical questions, typically with another member of the team or the lead of your function. It‚Äôs a chance for us to go deeper into your technical thinking and problem-solving approach, and for you to show how you tackle realistic challenges you‚Äôd face at Nebuly.
Offer üéâ: If it‚Äôs a match, we‚Äôll give you a call to walk through the offer details‚Äîcompensation, starting date, next steps‚Äîand answer any questions you might have.
Please submit your resume at careers@nebuly.ai, along with any relevant code samples or GitHub repositories, showcasing your backend development skills.

  2. Conversation with Your Future Manager (30min): Next, you‚Äôll meet the person you‚Äôd be directly reporting to. This call dives deeper into the role: the day-to-day responsibilities, challenges, and what success looks like. For technical roles, this will include a practical or coding interview.
  3. Logic Challenge (30min): A test with logic-based questions. This helps us understand how you approach unfamiliar problems.
  4. Behavioral Test (30min): You‚Äôll complete a short online behavioral assessment. This isn‚Äôt about right or wrong answers‚Äîit‚Äôs designed to give us insight into your working style, how you collaborate, and what kind of environment helps you do your best work. It also helps us ensure strong alignment between you and the culture at Nebuly.
  5. Meeting the Co-founders (30min): If you‚Äôve reached this step, things are looking great. You‚Äôll meet Nebuly‚Äôs co-founders to talk about your motivations, career goals, and what makes you thrive at work. It‚Äôs also your chance to get to know the people shaping the vision of the company.
  6. Role-Focused Project (2 hrs): At this stage, we‚Äôre genuinely excited about the possibility of working together. We‚Äôll propose a short project that reflects the kind of work you‚Äôd actually be doing at Nebuly. You‚Äôll have full flexibility on timing‚Äîwe‚Äôll work around your schedule to make sure it‚Äôs manageable and enjoyable.
  7. Deep-Dive Technical Session (1hr): This is a second round of technical questions, typically with another member of the team or the lead of your function. It‚Äôs a chance for us to go deeper into your technical thinking and problem-solving approach, and for you to show how you tackle realistic challenges you‚Äôd face at Nebuly.
  8. Offer üéâ: If it‚Äôs a match, we‚Äôll give you a call to walk through the offer details‚Äîcompensation, starting date, next steps‚Äîand answer any questions you might have.


Please submit your resume at careers@nebuly.ai, along with any relevant code samples or GitHub repositories, showcasing your backend development skills.
